definitions.definition: To become too big in size or too mature in age or outlook to continue to want, need, use, experience , or accept some object , practice , condition , belief , etc.
examples: Poorer children often have to wear whatever an older sibling has outgrown .
I used to have allergies but I outgrew all of them.
Some people blame God for their troubles, but one must outgrow such notions.

definitions.definition: To grow faster or larger than.
examples: The best adapted plant varieties tend to outgrow those less adapted.

main_definition: ( transitive , often figurative ) To become too big in size or too mature in age or outlook to continue to want, need, use, experience , or accept some object , practice , condition , belief , etc.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To grow faster or larger than.
